result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lacey Marie Mineweaser

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:49 AM Defendant Lacey Marie Mineweaser in court.  Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court for Lacey Marie Mineweaser.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Pribyl requests status.  Bond remains in effect
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:59 PM Defendant Lacey Marie Mineweaser in court.  Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court for Lacey Marie Mineweaser.  Prosecuting attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Pribyl requests prelim in felony cases, this case will follow those cases.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Contract for Repayment of Court-appointed Attorney Fees

9:47 AM  Defendant Lacey Marie Mineweaser in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court for Lacey Marie Mineweaser.  Court reviews events in file, reviews repayment of attorney fees with defendant.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea.  Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Atty Pribyl requests a status in 30 days. State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Subpoena Witness Data Sheet
Order Appointing Counsel
Appoint Pribyl. $100/month starting 9/15/22. DTE
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Defendant appeared on her own.

1:20 PM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lacey Marie Mineweaser in court.   Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on missed court appearance.  Defendant thought she had court today, not yesterday.  State not requesting any change in defendant's bond as defendant appeared voluntarily.  Court questions defendant where she's at in contacting SPD re: legal representation.  Defendant indicates she thought Atty Viel was representing her.  Court advises defendant to contact SPD office to see if she qualifies and if she does, to get counsel appointed.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.

11:37 AM  Defendant Lacey Marie Mineweaser not in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions State on how they wish to proceed with defendant's non-appearance.  State requests bench warrant.  Court orders bench warrant (statewide).
Status conference on July 28, 2022 at 11:15 am.

9:32 AM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lacey Marie Mineweaser in court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant indicates she hasn't talked to SPD office yet to see if she qualifies.  Court advises Atty Viel will be here shortly for another matter, advises defendant to wait in the waiting area for Mr. Viel and then return to court after speaking to him.  Back in session 10:41 am.  Atty Viel appears with defendant, indicates defendant does qualify in the latest file, advises defendant will need to qualify in the the two earlier files.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea.  Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 4/11/22.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Ensure children attend school every day with no unexcused absences or tardies.

8:50 AM  Defendant Lacey Marie Mineweaser in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.   Defendant requests time to retain an attorney or contact SPD to see if she qualifies.  Court questions defendant on address/employment.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
